group_1.textLeft: Back when I first contracted, they showed@me that day's newspaper, but...
The only thing I remember was that it said,
"Due to lack of negotiations, the Summit's efforts@to issue a joint statement were abandoned."

group_1.textRight: Yeah, that's basically what all the other@papers said, too...
But none of them explained what@happened next.

group_1.textLeft: Did you find anything, Sunao?

group_1.textRight: The reputable websites I've been able to find@all say the same thing.

group_1.textLeft: Reputable?

group_1.textRight: As opposed to websites that focus on gossip.
To put it another way, non-reputable websites...
...don't care whether a story is true or not, just@whether it's entertaining or interesting.

group_1.textLeft: We have to look beyond newspapers, and@into magazines and books, too.
Sunao, can you take a look at those...@"gawsip" websites?

group_1.textRight: I'll give you a hand, Shizuka!

group_1.textLeft: ...Any progress?
All we could find on our end were@untrustworthy articles.
Yeah, like...

group_1.narration: [textBlack:"Negotiations collapse!]@[textBlack:The truth of the Trilateral Economic Summit's failure!]@[textBlack:Behind the scenes, a psychic medium manipulates]@[textBlack:entire countriesâ€¦"]

group_1.textLeft: This is the only stuff we could find.

group_1.textRight: I've only found things like conspiracy theories or@allegations regarding the personal relationships@between politicians.
There was speculation on why the talks failed,
but nothing about what occurred as a result.

group_1.textLeft: ...That's strange, isn't it?
If Mikoshiba made me wish for it,
then it must have been a matter of national importance...

group_1.textRight: My impression is that she had carefully chosen what wishes to grant and who to ingratiate herself with.

group_1.textLeft: In that case...
Could it be that either Mikoshiba or@the person who bought the wish...
...were involved in a cover-up?
Was it something that would have been@bad if it were made public...?
(But why? It was a wish for our country...)

group_1.textRight: ...That could be what happened, but I think@we're out of leads in Kamihama.

group_1.textLeft: Maybe we can find something back@in the village?

group_1.textRight: It's not as though we could ask Mikoshiba@even if we wanted to.

group_1.textLeft: Still, if there's a chance that we can find clues,@I want to go.
Whatever happened as a consequence@of my wish...
I need to know what it all meant. I don't@want to be left in the dark.

group_1.textCenter: I want to know what the results of my wish were.
